contents.tooltip: An Ability check is used when innate talent in one of the six abilities
A Saving Throw represents an attempt to resist a spell, trap, poison, disease, or similar threat.
Initiative Roll
If a character is knowledgeable in the use of specific armour, weapons, tools, Skills, or Saving Throws, they are said to have proficiency in it.
A character’s Hit Points are a numerical measure that defines how tough and resilient they are in combat and other dangerous situations.
HP are temporarily lowered when the character receives damage.
A numerical measure of how hard it is to hit a target with sufficient force to inflict damage.

Energy represents a character’s reserve of personal stamina, luck, and spiritual power. They are used to power the Dynamic Powers and Spell-Like Ability Attributes, as well as other Attributes that have the Deplete Limiter.

Energy represents a character’s reserve of personal stamina, luck, and spiritual power. They are used to power the Dynamic Powers and Spell-Like Ability Attributes, as well as other Attributes that have the Deplete Limiter.
Initiative Roll
If a character is knowledgeable in the use of specific armour, weapons, tools, Skills, or Saving Throws, they are said to have proficiency in it.
A character’s Hit Points are a numerical measure that defines how tough and resilient they are in combat and other dangerous situations.
HP are temporarily lowered when the character receives damage.
A numerical measure of how hard it is to hit a target with sufficient force to inflict damage.
Max Energy

Energy represents a character’s reserve of personal stamina, luck, and spiritual power. They are used to power the Dynamic Powers and Spell-Like Ability Attributes, as well as other Attributes that have the Deplete Limiter.
Ground Movement Speed

Most characters and animals can swim at speeds equal to one-half their normal ground movement rate over short distances. A character with Water Speed, though, can float and travel both on and under water at even faster speeds for longer periods. The character can swim on the surface at high speeds and dive underwater for brief periods by holding their breath.

Tunnelling assumes that the character is going through sand or packed earth. Burrowing through extremely dense or rocky ground is one Rank slower; boring through solid rock is two Ranks slower. The tunnel the character leaves behind will either be permanent, or will collapse immediately (specified during the creation of each tunnel).
A character with this Attribute can achieve Flight through one (or possibly more) methods, including: wings, paranormal power, magic, anti-gravity, psionic levitation, or some other technique.
Ground movement speed.
Swim at a standard speed for great distances
Dash approximately 2x speed for moderate distances
Swim at a standard speed for great distances
Dash approximately 2x speed for moderate distances

Most characters and animals can swim at speeds equal to one-half their normal ground movement rate over short distances. A character with Water Speed, though, can float and travel both on and under water at even faster speeds for longer periods. The character can swim on the surface at high speeds and dive underwater for brief periods by holding their breath.

Tunnelling assumes that the character is going through sand or packed earth. Burrowing through extremely dense or rocky ground is one Rank slower; boring through solid rock is two Ranks slower. Tunnel at a standard speed for great distances
Dash approximately 2x speed for moderate distances

A character with this Attribute can achieve Flight through one (or possibly more) methods, including: wings, paranormal power, magic, anti-gravity, psionic levitation, or some other technique.
Fly at a standard speed for great distances
Dash approximately 2x speed for moderate distances
Fly at a standard speed for great distances
Dash approximately 2x speed for moderate distances
Size templates help describe the modifiers your character receives for being any size other than Medium
More specialised and diverse character aspects are known as Attributes, which can represent innate talents, learned skills, magical evocations, psionic powers, supernatural elements, and more.
More specialised and diverse character aspects are known as Attributes, which can represent innate talents, learned skills, magical evocations, psionic powers, supernatural elements, and more.

Adding an Enhancement to an Attribute does not change its Point cost, but rather it decreases the effective functioning Rank of the Attribute by 1 Rank. As detailed for the Weapon Attribute (page 124), this meant reducing the Weapon’s damage by -1d4 per Enhancement. You cannot add Enhancements if the effective Rank of an Attribute would drop below Rank 1.
Adding a Limiter to an Attribute does not change its Point cost, but rather it increases the effective functioning Rank of the Attribute by 1 Rank.

Adding an Enhancement to an Attribute does not change its Point cost, but rather it decreases the effective functioning Rank of the Attribute by 1 Rank. As detailed for the Weapon Attribute (page 124), this meant reducing the Weapon’s damage by -1d4 per Enhancement. You cannot add Enhancements if the effective Rank of an Attribute would drop below Rank 1.
Adding a Limiter to an Attribute does not change its Point cost, but rather it increases the effective functioning Rank of the Attribute by 1 Rank.

Defects indicate built-in flaws that make it difficult to use or render it less effective than normal. Carefully consider the number of Defects that burden your character. One to three Defects are typically appropriate, since your focus should be the capabilities of your character rather than their disadvantages.

Defects indicate built-in flaws that make it difficult to use or render it less effective than normal. Carefully consider the number of Defects that burden your character. One to three Defects are typically appropriate, since your focus should be the capabilities of your character rather than their disadvantages.
Races provide a set of proficiencies and Attributes (and sometimes Defects) that reflect the baseline capabilities for the majority of characters belonging to those Races.
Races provide a set of proficiencies and Attributes (and sometimes Defects) that reflect the baseline capabilities for the majority of characters belonging to those Races.
Classes frame the archetypal roles that a character plays, or life paths that a character follows. They include occupations, lifestyles, callings, and status.
When a character reaches specific XP totals, they gain a Character Level.

contents.tooltip: Proficiency with a Skill represents training or natural talent in a particular broad field. Characters add their Level-related Proficiency Bonus to relevant Skill checks.
Proficiency with a Skill represents training or natural talent in a particular broad field.
Proficiency with a Skill represents training or natural talent in a particular broad field.
Each skill has an associated ability that is required as a skill modifier.
Each skill has a proficiency rank, 0 meaning not proficient, then for each increment onwards the multiplied proficiency modifier will be added to the ascosiated skill roll.
A Skill check is a subset of an Ability check, except it is used when the task is governed by both an ability and a particular Skill
Talents that are rooted in higher learning – communications, language, research, and critical thinking – plus an understanding of institutions of knowledge (schools, magic academies, etc.).
Intelligence measures mental acuity, accuracy of recall, and the ability to reason.
Proficiency Bonus Multiplier
Talents that are rooted in higher learning – communications, language, research, and critical thinking – plus an understanding of institutions of knowledge (schools, magic academies, etc.).
The ability to perform feats of agility with minimal chance for injury. Includes balancing, jumping, flipping, contorting, and reacting quickly
Dexterity measures agility, reflexes, balance, and hand-eye co-ordination.
Proficiency Bonus Multiplier
The ability to perform feats of agility with minimal chance for injury. Includes balancing, jumping, flipping, contorting, and reacting quickly.

The knowledge of chemical formulae and processes to manipulate and transform liquids, solids, and gasses.
The ability to calm down a domesticated animal, know an animal’s natural inclinations, and intuit its intentions.
Wisdom reflects how attuned you are to the world around you and represents perceptiveness and intuition.
Proficiency Bonus Multiplier
The ability to calm down a domesticated animal, know an animal’s natural inclinations, and intuit its intentions.
The ability to recall lore about spells, magic items, eldritch symbols, magical traditions, the planes of existence, and the inhabitants of those planes.

Proficiency Bonus Multiplier
The ability to recall lore about spells, magic items, eldritch symbols, magical traditions, the planes of existence, and the inhabitants of those planes.
Knowledge of construction methods, architectural drafting, and more. A successful use of this Skill can also find weak points in constructions.
Intelligence measures mental acuity, accuracy of recall, and the ability to reason.
Proficiency Bonus Multiplier
Knowledge of construction methods, architectural drafting, and more. A successful use of this Skill can also find weak points in constructions.
Knowledge of the geography and people of a single area (choose one area) and a specific locale within it. The smaller the area, the more detailed and extensive the character’s knowledge.
Intelligence measures mental acuity, accuracy of recall, and the ability to reason.
Proficiency Bonus Multiplier
Knowledge of the geography and people of a single area (choose one area) and a specific locale within it. The smaller the area, the more detailed and extensive the character’s knowledge.

The ability to perform feats of strength with minimal chance for injury. Includes lifting or pushing heavy objects, stopping objects in motion, and supporting large weights.
The ability to organise, run, and understand part or all of a business organisation (including governments and associations). This Skill is also useful for recruiting and retaining employees.

The ability to organise, run, and understand part or all of a business organisation (including governments and associations). This Skill is also useful for recruiting and retaining employees.
The ability to traverse vertical surfaces with or without the use of dedicated climbing equipment, both natural (such as trees and cliffs) and artificial (such as buildings and defences).

The ability to traverse vertical surfaces with or without the use of dedicated climbing equipment, both natural (such as trees and cliffs) and artificial (such as buildings and defences).

The ability to determine the true intentions of a creature from body language, speech habits, and changes in mannerisms. This includes a talent for searching out a lie or predicting someone’s next move.

The ability to convince someone to provide specific information against their will. Interrogation can also be used to help withhold information when being forcefully questioned.

The talent for influencing someone through overt threats, hostile actions, and physical violence. A successful check means someone witnessing your performance is convinced you mean any threats you make. How they react will depend on how tough they are themselves in relation to the kind of threat you present – they may respond with respect, fear, hatred, or amusement.
Charisma measures your ability to interact effectively with others. It includes such factors as confidence and eloquence, and it can represent a charming or commanding personality.

The talent for detective work – searching around for clues and making deductions based on those clues. Includes spotting the location of a hidden object and discerning from the appearance of a wound what kind of weapon dealt it.

The talent for detective work – searching around for clues and making deductions based on those clues. Includes spotting the location of a hidden object and discerning from the appearance of a wound what kind of weapon dealt it.

A character with this Skill is adept at exploiting their sex appeal. A successful Skill check will convince another person that the character is genuinely interested in them. Whether or not the subject responds will depend on their own romantic inclinations and sexual preferences.

The ability to find food and shelter in the outdoors, to avoid natural hazards, and to identify edible and useful wild plants and animals. This Skill is often a learned area of expertise for more advanced cultures, but a natural way of life for more primitive ones.

If a character is knowledgeable in the use of specific armour, weapons, tools, Skills, or Saving Throws, they are said to have proficiency in it.
A character’s Hit Points are a numerical measure that defines how tough and resilient they are in combat and other dangerous situations.

A numerical measure of how hard it is to hit a target with sufficient force to inflict damage.

To reflect a more realistic portrayal of ranged engagements, optional attack roll penalties may apply when Weapons with the Range Enhancement exceeding two assignments target opponents at the extremes of their maximum ranges.

To reflect a more realistic portrayal of ranged engagements, optional attack roll penalties may apply when Weapons with the Range Enhancement exceeding two assignments target opponents at the extremes of their maximum ranges.
This is up to approximately one-third of the Weapon’s maximum range. If a target is within effective range, no modifiers apply to the attack rolls.
This is up to approximately one-third of the Weapon’s maximum range. If a target is within effective range, no modifiers apply to the attack rolls.
This is between the effective range and one-half of the Weapon’s maximum range. Attack rolls at this distance suffer a disadvantage.
This is between intermediate range up to the Weapon’s maximum range. Attack rolls at this distance suffer a disadvantage, and the attacker does not add their Dexterity modifier to the Weapon damage.

The DM assigns the task under consideration a DC before the roll is made. If the check total is equal to or higher than the DC, the task succeeds. If it is lower, the task fails. DMs should assign DCs based on how easy or difficult the task is to perform.

The DM assigns the task under consideration a DC before the roll is made. If the check total is equal to or higher than the DC, the task succeeds. If it is lower, the task fails. DMs should assign DCs based on how easy or difficult the task is to perform.

contents.tooltip: Ground Movement Speed
Ground Movement Speed
Walk at a standard speed for great distances
Jog approximately 1.5x speed for extended distances
Dash approximately 2x speed for moderate distances
Sprint approximately 5x speed for short distances
Walk at a standard speed for great distances
Jog approximately 1.5x speed for extended distances
Dash approximately 2x speed for moderate distances
Sprint approximately 5x speed for short distances
Walk at a standard speed for great distances
Jog approximately 1.5x speed for extended distances
Dash approximately 2x speed for moderate distances
Sprint approximately 5x speed for short distances

Most characters and animals can swim at speeds equal to one-half their normal ground movement rate over short distances. A character with Water Speed, though, can float and travel both on and under water at even faster speeds for longer periods. The character can swim on the surface at high speeds and dive underwater for brief periods by holding their breath.

Tunnelling assumes that the character is going through sand or packed earth. Burrowing through extremely dense or rocky ground is one Rank slower; boring through solid rock is two Ranks slower. The tunnel the character leaves behind will either be permanent, or will collapse immediately (specified during the creation of each tunnel).
A character with this Attribute can achieve Flight through one (or possibly more) methods, including: wings, paranormal power, magic, anti-gravity, psionic levitation, or some other technique.

A character with Water Speed, though, can float and travel both on and under water at even faster speeds for longer periods. The character can swim on the surface at high speeds and dive underwater for brief periods by holding their breath.
Swim at a standard speed for great distances
Dash approximately 2x speed for moderate distances
Swim at a standard speed for great distances
Dash approximately 2x speed for moderate distances

Dash approximately 2x speed for moderate distances

DMs can allow characters to jump as far as seems dramatically appropriate. A Medium character can typically jump forward with a running start a distance in feet equal to their Strength (or half that distance from standing). For vertical leaps, a character can jump up to 3 + their Strength modifier in feet (1 foot minimum).

DMs can allow characters to jump as far as seems dramatically appropriate. A Medium character can typically jump forward with a running start a distance in feet equal to their Strength (or half that distance from standing). For vertical leaps, a character can jump up to 3 + their Strength modifier in feet (1 foot minimum).
A Medium-sized character can push, drag, or lift 30 lb times their Strength Score. They can freely manoeuvre and comfortably carry one-half that amount (15 lb times Strength).

contents.tooltip: Stats, Attributes, and Proficiencies
Size templates help describe the modifiers your character receives for being any size other than Medium
Size templates help describe the modifiers your character receives for being any size other than Medium

Each character has proficiencies, including: armour, weapons, tools, Saving Throws, and Skills. When making d20 dice rolls for circumstances that involve the character’s proficiencies, the character adds their Proficiency Bonus to the roll. If a character wears armour with which they lack proficiency, they suffer a disadvantage on Ability Checks, Saving Throws, and attack rolls that involve Strength or Dexterity, and they can’t cast spells.

Each character has proficiencies, including: armour, weapons, tools, Saving Throws, and Skills. When making d20 dice rolls for circumstances that involve the character’s proficiencies, the character adds their Proficiency Bonus to the roll. If a character wears armour with which they lack proficiency, they suffer a disadvantage on Ability Checks, Saving Throws, and attack rolls that involve Strength or Dexterity, and they can’t cast spells.
Basic Character Information
Races provide a set of proficiencies and Attributes (and sometimes Defects) that reflect the baseline capabilities for the majority of characters belonging to those Races.
Races provide a set of proficiencies and Attributes (and sometimes Defects) that reflect the baseline capabilities for the majority of characters belonging to those Races.
Classes frame the archetypal roles that a character plays, or life paths that a character follows. They include occupations, lifestyles, callings, and status.
When a character reaches specific XP totals, they gain a Character Level.

Proficiency with a Skill represents training or natural talent in a particular broad field. Characters add their Level-related Proficiency Bonus to relevant Skill checks.
Proficiency with a Skill represents training or natural talent in a particular broad field.
Proficiency with a Skill represents training or natural talent in a particular broad field.
Each skill has an associated ability that is required as a skill modifier.
Each skill has a proficiency rank, 0 meaning not proficient, then for each increment onwards the multiplied proficiency modifier will be added to the ascosiated skill roll.
A Skill check is a subset of an Ability check, except it is used when the task is governed by both an ability and a particular Skill

The ability to convince people to see new perspectives, consider other alternatives, change their minds, make different decisions, and even modify their actions.
Charisma measures your ability to interact effectively with others. It includes such factors as confidence and eloquence, and it can represent a charming or commanding personality.
Proficiency Bonus Multiplier
The ability to convince people to see new perspectives, consider other alternatives, change their minds, make different decisions, and even modify their actions.
An understanding of natural world sciences that focuses on movement, universal forces (such as gravity and magnetism), and energy (such as sound and light).
Intelligence measures mental acuity, accuracy of recall, and the ability to reason.
Proficiency Bonus Multiplier
An understanding of natural world sciences that focuses on movement, universal forces (such as gravity and magnetism), and energy (such as sound and light).
The ability to recall lore about deities, rites and prayers, religious hierarchies, ethical standards, holy symbols, and the practices of secret cults.
Intelligence measures mental acuity, accuracy of recall, and the ability to reason.
Proficiency Bonus Multiplier
The ability to recall lore about deities, rites and prayers, religious hierarchies, ethical standards, holy symbols, and the practices of secret cults.
This is the knowledge of how to care for a riding beast, how to saddle, mount, and dismount the animal, how to get it to perform difficult or dangerous manoeuvres safely
Dexterity measures agility, reflexes, balance, and hand-eye co-ordination.
Proficiency Bonus Multiplier
This is the knowledge of how to care for a riding beast, how to saddle, mount, and dismount the animal, how to get it to perform difficult or dangerous manoeuvres safely

A character with this Skill is adept at exploiting their sex appeal. A successful Skill check will convince another person that the character is genuinely interested in them. Whether or not the subject responds will depend on their own romantic inclinations and sexual preferences.
Charisma measures your ability to interact effectively with others. It includes such factors as confidence and eloquence, and it can represent a charming or commanding personality.
Proficiency Bonus Multiplier

A character with this Skill is adept at exploiting their sex appeal. A successful Skill check will convince another person that the character is genuinely interested in them. Whether or not the subject responds will depend on their own romantic inclinations and sexual preferences.

A character with this Skill (also known as “prestidigitation”) has superior manual dexterity. This includes the ability to perform “magic” tricks, palm small objects, cheat at cards, plant an item on someone, etc.
Dexterity measures agility, reflexes, balance, and hand-eye co-ordination.
Proficiency Bonus Multiplier

A character with this Skill (also known as “prestidigitation”) has superior manual dexterity. This includes the ability to perform “magic” tricks, palm small objects, cheat at cards, plant an item on someone, etc.
The ability to disguise objects or people so that they blend into their surroundings. This also includes the ability to conceal small objects on one’s person and the ability to move silently.
Dexterity measures agility, reflexes, balance, and hand-eye co-ordination.
Proficiency Bonus Multiplier
The ability to disguise objects or people so that they blend into their surroundings. This also includes the ability to conceal small objects on one’s person and the ability to move silently.
The ability to navigate street culture within cities and larger urban areas, and how to survive and thrive in such settings.
Charisma measures your ability to interact effectively with others. It includes such factors as confidence and eloquence, and it can represent a charming or commanding personality.
Proficiency Bonus Multiplier
The ability to navigate street culture within cities and larger urban areas, and how to survive and thrive in such settings.

The ability to find food and shelter in the outdoors, to avoid natural hazards, and to identify edible and useful wild plants and animals. This Skill is often a learned area of expertise for more advanced cultures, but a natural way of life for more primitive ones.
Wisdom reflects how attuned you are to the world around you and represents perceptiveness and intuition.
Proficiency Bonus Multiplier

The ability to find food and shelter in the outdoors, to avoid natural hazards, and to identify edible and useful wild plants and animals. This Skill is often a learned area of expertise for more advanced cultures, but a natural way of life for more primitive ones.
The knowledge of efficient body movement in liquids, including surface swimming and deeper diving.
Constitution measures health, stamina, and vital force.
Proficiency Bonus Multiplier
The knowledge of efficient body movement in liquids, including surface swimming and deeper diving.
The ability to create and place traps in both natural and constructed settings. Also covers disarming of discovered traps.
Dexterity measures agility, reflexes, balance, and hand-eye co-ordination.
Proficiency Bonus Multiplier
The ability to create and place traps in both natural and constructed settings. Also covers disarming of discovered traps.
The ability to produce a work of fine or commercial art in one or more visual fields (carving, painting, sculpting, etc.).
Wisdom reflects how attuned you are to the world around you and represents perceptiveness and intuition.
Proficiency Bonus Multiplier
The ability to produce a work of fine or commercial art in one or more visual fields (carving, painting, sculpting, etc.).
The knowledge of largescale military combat techniques, including troop movement, siege warfare, and army morale.
Wisdom reflects how attuned you are to the world around you and represents perceptiveness and intuition.
Proficiency Bonus Multiplier
The knowledge of largescale military combat techniques, including troop movement, siege warfare, and army morale.

contents.name: Basic Information

contents.tooltip: Attributes and Defects
More specialised and diverse character aspects are known as Attributes, which can represent innate talents, learned skills, magical evocations, psionic powers, supernatural elements, and more.
More specialised and diverse character aspects are known as Attributes, which can represent innate talents, learned skills, magical evocations, psionic powers, supernatural elements, and more.

Adding an Enhancement to an Attribute does not change its Point cost, but rather it decreases the effective functioning Rank of the Attribute by 1 Rank. As detailed for the Weapon Attribute (page 124), this meant reducing the Weapon’s damage by -1d4 per Enhancement. You cannot add Enhancements if the effective Rank of an Attribute would drop below Rank 1.
Adding a Limiter to an Attribute does not change its Point cost, but rather it increases the effective functioning Rank of the Attribute by 1 Rank.

Adding an Enhancement to an Attribute does not change its Point cost, but rather it decreases the effective functioning Rank of the Attribute by 1 Rank. As detailed for the Weapon Attribute (page 124), this meant reducing the Weapon’s damage by -1d4 per Enhancement. You cannot add Enhancements if the effective Rank of an Attribute would drop below Rank 1.
Adding a Limiter to an Attribute does not change its Point cost, but rather it increases the effective functioning Rank of the Attribute by 1 Rank.

Defects indicate built-in flaws that make it difficult to use or render it less effective than normal. Carefully consider the number of Defects that burden your character. One to three Defects are typically appropriate, since your focus should be the capabilities of your character rather than their disadvantages.

Defects indicate built-in flaws that make it difficult to use or render it less effective than normal. Carefully consider the number of Defects that burden your character. One to three Defects are typically appropriate, since your focus should be the capabilities of your character rather than their disadvantages.

contents.tooltip: Initiative Roll
A character’s Hit Points are a numerical measure that defines how tough and resilient they are in combat and other dangerous situations.
HP are temporarily lowered when the character receives damage.
A numerical measure of how hard it is to hit a target with sufficient force to inflict damage.

Energy represents a character’s reserve of personal stamina, luck, and spiritual power. They are used to power the Dynamic Powers and Spell-Like Ability Attributes, as well as other Attributes that have the Deplete Limiter.

Energy represents a character’s reserve of personal stamina, luck, and spiritual power. They are used to power the Dynamic Powers and Spell-Like Ability Attributes, as well as other Attributes that have the Deplete Limiter.
Initiative Roll
A character’s Hit Points are a numerical measure that defines how tough and resilient they are in combat and other dangerous situations.
HP are temporarily lowered when the character receives damage.
A numerical measure of how hard it is to hit a target with sufficient force to inflict damage.
Max Energy

Energy represents a character’s reserve of personal stamina, luck, and spiritual power. They are used to power the Dynamic Powers and Spell-Like Ability Attributes, as well as other Attributes that have the Deplete Limiter.
Ground Movement Speed

Most characters and animals can swim at speeds equal to one-half their normal ground movement rate over short distances. A character with Water Speed, though, can float and travel both on and under water at even faster speeds for longer periods. The character can swim on the surface at high speeds and dive underwater for brief periods by holding their breath.

Tunnelling assumes that the character is going through sand or packed earth. Burrowing through extremely dense or rocky ground is one Rank slower; boring through solid rock is two Ranks slower. The tunnel the character leaves behind will either be permanent, or will collapse immediately (specified during the creation of each tunnel).
A character with this Attribute can achieve Flight through one (or possibly more) methods, including: wings, paranormal power, magic, anti-gravity, psionic levitation, or some other technique.
Ground movement speed.
Swim at a standard speed for great distances
Dash approximately 2x speed for moderate distances
Swim at a standard speed for great distances
Dash approximately 2x speed for moderate distances
